p: The northern elephant seal was nearly eliminated by overhunting in the 19th century, and consequently suffered a severe population bottleneck that reduced its genetic diversity [ 14, 15, 16], likely making it highly vulnerable to environmental changes [ 17]. At the beginning of the 21st century, the California population was estimated around 179,000 individuals, and the average annual growth rate was estimated at 3.8% between 1988 and 2010 [ 18]. The current status of the Baja California population is unknown.
